title: Saar Biotech - Terbutaline, Guaiphenesin, Ambroxol and Menthol Syrup |  Chest Tightness
meta: Ambroxol is a secretolytic agent used in the treatment of respiratory diseases associated with viscid or excessive mucus. Terbutaline is used for the prevention and reversal of bronchospasm in patients 12 years of age and older with reversible, obstructive airway disease, as well as symptomatic management of reversible bronchospasm associated with bronchitis and emphysema. Guaifenesin elicits an action to facilitate productive cough to manage chest congestion. Menthol mediates anesthetic properties and anti-irritating properties locally, thus it is widely used to relieve minor throat irritations.
